Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 20TH DYNASTY ?; 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after)
Name: Lid of a canopic jar
Description: This lid of a canopic jar of terracotta comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Abydos. It takes the form of a falcon head, whose face is painted in yellow, the eyes in black and the beak in red-brown. The black-coloured wig is decorated with yellow lines. This exemplar belongs to a type of canopic jar lid dating from the 20th Dynasty.
